raw_comment:
I noticed that for students who have a legacy at prestigious colleges, they will have a better chance at getting into the college versus students with the same test scores who do not have a legacy. I also notice that students who come from higher income households have a better chance at getting in. I wonder if the students with wealthier parents have a better chance because their parents are donating money or have a better reputation. This applies to me and my community because as kids are applying to colleges it is important to know how other people have more advantages and how it is unfair. 
"Elite take on college"
ace_sentences: Some students have a legacy at a prestigious college.
If a student has a legacy at a prestigious college then the student has a better chance of admission to the college.
Some students do not have a legacy at a prestigious college.
Some students have the same test scores as other students.
If a student does not have a legacy then the student has a worse chance of admission than a student with the same test scores who has a legacy.
Some students come from higher-income households.
If a student comes from a higher-income household then the student has a better chance of admission.
I wonder whether parents donate money to a college.
I wonder whether parents have a better reputation.
I wonder whether these factors increase the chance of admission for students with wealthier parents.
Kids in my community apply to colleges.
It is important for kids in my community to know that some people have more advantages in college admission.
I think that this situation is unfair.
The headline is: Elite take on college.
